intro: Fraxinus excelsior var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ash, is a variant of the common ash tree native to Europe. It is characterized by its narrower, elongated leaves that are typically longer than they are wide. The tree produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in upright clusters, followed by winged seeds called samaras. It prefers well-drained soils and can thrive in a variety of light conditions. This variety is often found in woodland areas and is valued for its ecological role in supporting biodiversity.
